Description: Rim and neck sherd of Attic black-figured pottery amphora; interior glazed black; flat top of rim reserved; on outside, incised spoked rosettes with added red on hearts; below on neck, wide black band with traces of superimposed added red band; below, frieze of alternating red and black tongues.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 248-9, no. B142)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0059) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 94, pl. II, no. 24)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
